ShouldersDoorway.name: Doorway Front Deltoid Stretch
ShouldersDoorway.preparation: Stand at end of wall or in doorway facing perpendicular to wall. Position palm on surface of wall slightly lower than shoulder. Bend elbow slightly.
ShouldersDoorway.execution: Turn body away from positioned arm. Hold stretch. Repeat with opposite arm.
ShouldersDoorway.comments: A stationary bar can also be used instead of wall.

ShouldersSeated.name: Lying Front Deltoid Stretch
ShouldersSeated.preparation: Sit on floor or mat. Lean back and place hands flat on floor behind body slightly wider than shoulder width with fingers positioned away from body.
ShouldersSeated.execution: Scoot hips forward away from hands. Hold stretch.
ShouldersSeated.comments: Instead of scooting hips forward, hands can be eased backwards.

ShouldersPNFSeated.name: PNF Seated Front Deltoid Stretch
ShouldersPNFSeated.preparation: Instruct participant to sit on floor or bench and place arms to behind hips. From behind, grasp participants wrists, positioning them wider than shoulder width.
ShouldersPNFSeated.execution: Continue to raise participants arms upward behind their body, out to sides. Hold stretch.
ShouldersPNFSeated.comments: See PNF stretch techniques. Also see Seated Front Deltoid Stretch for similar static stretch.

ShouldersWall.name: Wall Front Deltoid Stretch
ShouldersWall.preparation: Face away from wall. Bend over and place hands slightly wider than shoulder width as high as possible on wall with fingers positioned upward.
ShouldersWall.execution: Bring rear end and back toward wall and squat down. Hold stretch for 20 seconds.
ShouldersWall.comments: A stationary bar can also be used instead of wall.
